data.title: Bring back the old Channel 4 Tour de France Music
data.meta_description:
I know it's wrong to live in the past but this music still haunts me today.

The great heydays of the mid 80's when Hinault Fignon Yates Kelly Millar Roche...
data.text:
I know it's wrong to live in the past but this music still haunts me today.

The great heydays of the mid 80's when Hinault Fignon Yates Kelly Millar Roche were all about

Hard to believe it derived from a Buzzcock's song or should I say Pete Shelley?

Oh God it's just makes memories flood back.Richard Keyes and Steve Sherwin. I remember going out one night to celebrate Sean Yates winning a stage and got plastered!!!!No wife then so mum is a bit more understanding God Bless 'er.

I have no recollection of that theme music at all. TBH I have very little recollection of that era.

They didn't use the extended version very often. This was the classic title sequence, which just used the guitar riff and the Frère Jacques pastiche:

View: https://youtu.be/1IMjb6sU5Mg

I don't remember Richard Keys presenting, only Gary Imlach (who also presented C4's US football coverage in those days).

They didn't use the extended version very often. This was the classic title sequence, which just used the guitar riff and the Frère Jacques pastiche:

View: https://youtu.be/1IMjb6sU5Mg

I don't remember Richard Keys presenting, only Gary Imlach (who also presented C4's US football coverage in those days).

I've just checked and might be confused with the Kellogsg Tour of Britain

I've just checked and might be confused with the Kellogsg Tour of Britain

Same tune, just a slightly different cut without the Frère Jacques bit.

Same tune, just a slightly different cut without the Frère Jacques bit.

I was referring to Richards Keys doing Kellogg's TOB but have checked further and Keyes did do the TDF as well!!!

I was referring to Richards Keys doing Kellogg's TOB but have checked further and Keyes did do the TDF as well!!!

Yeah, I know he presented the Tour coverage in the early years, and I must have watched it with him, but I don't remember him.

Yeah, I know he presented the Tour coverage in the early years, and I must have watched it with him, but I don't remember him.

He was the presenter when Roche won in 1987, with Barry Hoban as studio expert on one occasion.

They didn't use the extended version very often. This was the classic title sequence, which just used the guitar riff and the Frère Jacques pastiche:

View: https://youtu.be/1IMjb6sU5Mg

I don't remember Richard Keys presenting, only Gary Imlach (who also presented C4's US football coverage in those days).

Superb mullet there from Gert-Jan Theunisse. I'd quite like one of those PDM Concorde bikes .
